\[ \text{Total number of days} = 12 \times 365.25 = 4383 \text{ days} \]
\[ \text{Number of orbits} = \frac{4383}{365.25} \approx 11.97 \]

Since Earth completes just over 11 orbits during the Napoleonic Wars, it has indeed completed at least one orbit around the Sun during this period. The answer is: true.

- End date: 1815
